Chapter on Entering the Inconceivable Liberation Realm and the Vows of Samantabhadra

At that time, the youth Sudhana properly contemplated the night spirit Great Vows, Effort, Power, and Protector of All Sentient Beings, with the power of liberation manifesting bodies seen by the minds of all sentient beings, manifesting bodies with the appearance of all sentient beings, manifesting bodies with an ocean of boundless forms and appearances, manifesting bodies with an ocean of deportment in all places and times;

manifesting such bodies through the universal gate, using various skillful means to teach and transform according to the minds of sentient beings, enabling them to awaken and increase their roots of goodness, to practice in accordance with the profound liberations of bodhisattvas.

In this way he followed and obtained immeasurable excellent merits.
Gradually proceeding, he crossed the Ganges to the north and entered the country of Kosala. He headed towards the city of Kapila and the Lumbini Grove.
Having arrived, he circumambulated to the right, seeking the forest spirit of Sublime Virtue, Perfect and Beloved.

Good man!

Buddha Dharmas all able to enter in accordance, ultimately attaining the realm of true meaning.ğŸ”½What are the ten?
They are:

the womb of birth of bodhisattvas who always serve all buddhas and bodhisattvas, the womb of birth of bodhisattvas who universally accomplish the mind of enlightenment, the womb of birth of bodhisattvas who contemplate the teachings and practice skillful means, the womb of birth of bodhisattvas who illuminate the three times with a profound and pure mind, the womb of birth of bodhisattvas who universally illuminate all with impartial light, the womb of birth of bodhisattvas who are born into the family of all tathÄgatas of the three times, the womb of birth of bodhisattvas who are universally adorned with the light of the Buddha's power, the womb of birth of bodhisattvas who minutely observe the universal wisdom gates, the womb of birth of bodhisattvas who are adorned with various transformations of the Dharma realm, and the womb of birth of bodhisattvas who swiftly tread the ground of the tathÄgatas.
Good sons!
What is called the womb of birth of bodhisattvas who always serve all buddhas and bodhisattvas?
Good sons!
When this bodhisattva first gives rise to the mind of enlightenment, he makes this vow:
'I shall personally approach and serve the buddhas and bodhisattvas, directly see the buddhas, and always give rise to joy;
in the presence of the buddhas, with a respectful mind I shall make offerings without ever being satisfied;
increasing pure faith, my mind will never turn back;
accumulating merit, I shall always be unceasing.'
In order to purify the nature of omniscience, to accumulate roots of goodness and cause them to increase,
this is called the bodhisattvas' first womb of birth.
What is called the bodhisattvas' womb of birth that universally accomplishes the resolve for enlightenment?
Good sons!
This bodhisattva gives rise to the resolve for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, namely:
Giving rise to a deeply compassionate mind, because he is able to save and protect all sentient beings;
Giving rise to a mind of making offerings to the buddhas, in order to cause the tathÄgatas to increase in joy;
Giving rise to a mind diligently seeking the true Dharma, because he is not stingy with any possessions;
They give rise to the mind of vast activity, in order to manifest all knowledge;
They give rise to the mind of perfect great kindness, in order to universally embrace and benefit all sentient beings;
They give rise to the mind of not abandoning sentient beings, in order to don the armor of vows for seeking omniscience;
They give rise to the mind free from deceit and illusion, in order to attain true wisdom and universally illuminate all differentiated phenomena;
They give rise to the mind of practicing as spoken, in order to cultivate and practice all the difficult practices of the bodhisattvas;
They give rise to the mind of not deceiving all buddhas, in order to always protect the great vows of all tathÄgatas;
They give rise to the mind of great vows for omniscience, in order to tame sentient beings without interruption until the end of the future.

These ten are foremost, with the merit of the bodhi mind being as numerous as atoms in a buddha land. If bodhisattvas accomplish these dharmas, they will always be born in the families of the tathÄgatas;
This is the bodhisattvas' second womb of birth.
What is the bodhisattvas' womb of birth that observes the methods of all dharmas and practices them?
Good man!
This bodhisattva, in the ocean of all Dharma gates, gives rise to a mind of direct observation;
In the perfect path of omniscience, he gives rise to a mind of accomplishment and dedication;
In the ocean of pure practices of all deportments, he gives rise to a mind of correct mindfulness and observation;
In the ocean of various samÄdhis of all bodhisattvas, he gives rise to a mind of universal purity;
In the ocean of various merits and virtues of all bodhisattvas, he gives rise to a mind of cultivation and completion;
In all the paths of bodhisattvas, he gives rise to a mind of adornment and emergence;
In the merits and virtues of diligence for omniscience, he gives rise to a mind of burning like a kalpa fire without rest;
In the realm of all sentient beings, he gives rise to a mind of causing them to accomplish the practices of Samantabhadra;
In all deportments, he gives rise to a mind of cultivating the various merits and virtues of bodhisattvas;
In the true middle way, they abandon existence and nonexistence and enter the mind of correct contemplation of the truth;
This is the bodhisattvas' third womb of birth.
What is meant by the bodhisattvas' womb of birth that with a profoundly pure mind universally illuminates the three times?
Good sons!

This bodhisattva achieves a pure, superior, profound mind, obtains the light of the Buddha's enlightenment that universally illuminates, and deeply enters the Dharma ocean of the bodhisattvas' skillful means;
His mind is firm like vajra, he embraces sentient beings and never abandons them;

He is far removed from all the destinies of birth and death, and achieves the TathÄgata's various spiritual transformations. He destroys all the mountains of obstacles and becomes a refuge for all sentient beings;
This is the bodhisattvas' fourth womb of birth.
What is meant by the Bodhisattvas' treasury of birth that equally illuminates with the light of equality?
Good man!
This Bodhisattva cultivates the ocean of various skillful means, taming and maturing all sentient beings;
He can completely abandon all possessions, accomplishing the boundless pure essence of precepts;
Abiding in the Buddha's realm, fully endowed with patience, he attains the light of patience for all Buddha-dharmas;

He realizes the profound Dharma-nature of all, freely teaching and maturing sentient beings, able to bring joy to the world, diligently cultivating the differentiated true Dharma gates;

Good sons!
This bodhisattva, dwelling in the youth stage, attains the various deportments of the bodhisattvas, and is replete with all merits and virtues. He minutely observes the gateway to omniscience;
in each and every gateway, for innumerable eons, he expounds and analyzes the boundless realms of experience of the bodhisattvas;

Abiding in the ocean of omniscience without middle or edge, they do not miss the time for transforming beings as needed;
